result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael S. Hale was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Clark County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is to report immediately to Probation when released from jail.
Consecutive to: Imposed sentences on Ct 2 in this case and Ct 2 in case 14CF24

miscConds.notes: Restitution , fee, surcharges and costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Fess, surcharges and costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Defendant is to remain employed or in school and not change employment without agents approval, if not employed job searches to be done as determined by his agent and report then to his agent.
Defendant shall attend counseling, programing, treatments, or evualtions as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request.

The defendant shall have no contact with Kenny Flick or Andrew Rademann  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  The defendant shall submit to random urine testing/PBT's as required by the agent or any law enforcement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Defendant granted a payment plan of $50.00 per month to begin 9/15/2014, this will also include the costs on Ct 2 in case 14CF24

Defendant to commence his sentence on or before 09/19/2014 no later than 6:30 p.m.  Huber granted.  
Condition of a delayed jail start date is the defendant is to remain alcohol free/maintaining absolute sobriety.  Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis and/or preliminary breath test upon request of law enforcement.  If the defendant refuses that request or if either test would register positive for alcohol the defendant's term of incarceration is to begin immediately.
Consecutive to: Jail sentence on Ct 2 in Case 14CF24.

11:25 AM Attorney Melissa S. Inlow appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Michael S. Hale appeared, pro se     Defendant was advised of right to attorney and waived that right  at this time.  Defendant pays $100.0 a week for restitution, he does not want to have his probation extended again.  He was set for probation for 2 years and has been on for 6 years.  He does not seem fair to be on probation just for a payment.  Court is going to extend his probation for 1 year, same conditions.
